forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. South wind 2 to 6 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Showers And Thunderstorms Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 7am, then areas of fog and a chance of rain showers between 7am and 1pm, then showers and thunderstorms likely between 1pm and 2pm, then areas of fog and showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a high near 71. Southeast wind 2 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the quiet hours of the night lull Boston into a gentle embrace, a shroud of fog creeps in like whispers between the trees, setting the stage for a day cloaked in mystery. With the air settling around a warm 62 degrees, there is a stillness that hints at a waking world soon soft with moisture and possibility. By morning, expect the fog to linger, perhaps obscuring familiar landmarks, while the promise of rain showers dances lightly in the breeze.

As the day unfolds, the veil of fog will draw back to reveal cloudy skies, with temperatures rising to a muted 71. An orchestra of rain showers may make their entrance, punctuated by the occasional rumble of thunder, creating a symphony of weather that matches the turning of the season. This is a day graced by the moisture of life, wherein a light jacket and well-prepared footwear will serve you well. An afternoon spent navigating the rich tapestry of Boston’s streets, perhaps catching a quiet moment at a café or revisiting a beloved bookstore, would be well complemented by a warm drink in hand. Those who seek solace in the rhythmic patter of rain may find pleasure in simple pursuits—observe the rain-soaked foliage, or let the rhythm of the day guide you toward a hidden gallery. Embrace the gentle embrace of this late spring day, for it holds the beauty of renewal just beneath its cloudy surface.
